Description: Painted wooden shabti of Nbt pr Šmʿyt n Imn Inh3y with a blue lappet-wig, a brown modelled face(damaged) with black and white eyes, a blue, green and white collar that encloses the parallel brown hands in low relief holding two red hoes; the yellow leg section is inscribed with a column of black painted Hieroglyphs flanked by six similar rows; the back is decorated with a red and yellow representation of a seed-basket.
Condition: fair - damage to face and left side
Acquisition name: Purchased from: R J Moss & Co
